Description: Aeolian Wild Goat Style pottery askos with wide body, reconstructed from numerous fragments and plaster; most of handle and spout plaster; brownish cream slip; on outer surface of flat, triple-reeded handle short horizontal dashes; on body underneath handle wide black horizontal zone that extends to spout; around it band rays and two dilute lines; below, two alternating groups of grazing goats and running dogs (chests and necks painted in added red) to right; maeanders, crosses decorated with dotted chevrons, dashes, dot rosettes, dashed crosses, zigzags, spirals, lozenges, and pendant roundels as filling ornament; below, second frieze of animals consisting of three grazing goats (one to left and two to right), one running dog, and one hare (necks and chests of goats and dog in added red); same filling ornament as on previous frieze; below, band of short vertical strokes above rays around foot of vase, with lozenges in interstices; ring foot, reserved on underside; around spout, cable pattern between bands.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ4
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 40, pl. V, no. 1)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.243, no.10)
Kerschner 2006 / On the Provenance of Aiolian Pottery (p.123 fig. 7, Appendix 2 Nau1a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.01)
